block.p: The Rev. Phyllis Kimberleigh Jordan was married on Wednesday evening to the Rev. John Henry Vaughn Jr. at Riverside Church in New York. The Rev. Dr. James A. Forbes Jr., an American Baptist minister, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Dr. Barbara Austin Lucas, an African Methodist Episcopal minister, taking part.

The bride, who is known as Kim, is keeping her surname. She is an associate minister at Marble Collegiate Church in New York, where she uses liturgical dance and choreography in her ministry. She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and received a master of divinity degree from Union Theological Seminary in New York. She also received a certificate from the professional training program at Dance Theater of Harlem.

She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and received a master of divinity degree from Union Theological Seminary in New York. She also received a certificate from the professional training program at Dance Theater of Harlem.

Her mother, Dr. Marguerite Mann Jordan of Sicklerville, N.J., is a retired speech pathologist who worked in the Wake County public schools in Raleigh, N.C. The bride's father, the late John M. Jordan III, was a chef at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York before moving to San Francisco.

Mr. Vaughn, an American Baptist minister, is the executive director of the Peace Development Fund, a foundation in Amherst, Mass., that finances social justice programs. He graduated from the College of the Holy Cross and received a master of divinity degree from the Pacific School of Religion. His previous marriage ended in divorce.

His mother, Dr. Orgretta V. McNeil of Worcester, Mass., retired as an associate professor of psychology at Holy Cross and is a member of the Worcester School Committee. The bridegroom's father, the late John H. Vaughn Sr., was a physicist with Curtiss-Wright and lived in Bloomfield, N.J. The bridegroom's stepfather, the late Kingsley R. McNeil, ran a courier service in Worcester.
